Beads description:
Several Graffiti components use viewport-based units (vw, vh) which cause issues when nested inside constrained containers like sidebar layouts.

**Problematic components:**
- .header - uses viewport-based sizing
- .full-bleed - breaks out to viewport width
- .swipe.full-bleed - same issue

**The problem:**
When these components are used inside a sidebar layout or any constrained container, they overflow or push the container because they reference the viewport, not their container.

**Potential solutions to explore:**
1. Container queries - make layouts auto-set container-type on main content areas
2. Documentation changes - show these components in appropriate contexts, warn about viewport limitations
3. Modifiers - add .contained variants that use container-relative units
4. Rethink the components - maybe full-bleed shouldn't use vw at all

**Related:**
- Fluid typography system also uses vw but has .fc class for container-based sizing
- May need to audit all vw/vh usage in drop-in.css

This epic should result in either:
- Fixed components that work in nested contexts
- Clear documentation about when/where to use these components
- Or both
